Class CameraFlightAnimation

Animates its View's Camera to look at specified objects, boundaries or locations.

Summary
  • Belongs to a View, and is located at View.cameraFlight
  • Controls the View's Camera, which is located at View.camera
  • Navigates the Camera to look at a SceneModel, SceneObject or boundary
  • Navigates the Camera to an explicit position given as eye, look and up vectors
  • Jumps or flies the Camera
  • Smoothly transitions between projections

Hierarchy

  • Component
    • CameraFlightAnimation

fit

  • get fit(): boolean
  • set fit(value: boolean): void
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/camera/CameraFlightAnimation.ts:556

    When flying to a SceneModel, SceneObject or boundary, indicates if the CameraFlightAnimation always adjusts the distance of Camera.eye from Camera.look to ensure that the target always fits in view.

    When false, the eye will remain fixed at its current distance from the look position.

    Default value is true.

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/camera/CameraFlightAnimation.ts:544

    When flying to a SceneModel, SceneObject or boundary, indicates if the CameraFlightAnimation always adjusts the distance of Camera.eye from Camera.look to ensure that the target always fits in view.

    When false, the eye will remain fixed at its current distance from the look position.

    Default value is true.

    Parameters

    • value: boolean

    Returns void

  • set fitFOV(value: number): void
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/camera/CameraFlightAnimation.ts:576

    Default value is 45.

    Returns number

flyTo

  • flyTo(params?: {}, callback: () => void): void
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/camera/CameraFlightAnimation.ts:150

    Flies the Camera to a target.

    • When the target is a boundary, the Camera will fly towards the target and stop when the target fills most of the canvas.
    • When the target is an explicit Camera position, given as eye, look and up, then CameraFlightAnimation will interpolate the Camera to that target and stop there.

    Parameters

    • params: {} = {}
    • callback: () => void
        • (): void

        • Returns void

    Returns void

jumpTo

  • jumpTo(params: any): void
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/camera/CameraFlightAnimation.ts:333

    Jumps the View's Camera to the given target.

    • When the target is a boundary, this CameraFlightAnimation will position the Camera at where the target fills most of the canvas.
    • When the target is an explicit Camera position, given as eye, look and up vectors, then this CameraFlightAnimation will jump the Camera to that target.

    Parameters

    • params: any

      Either a parameters object or a Component subtype that has a World-space AABB.

    Returns void
